column1: School of Medicine, Dentistry & Biomedical Sciences

The past decade has seen enormous advances in molecular and biomedical technology resulting in an‘omics’ revolution.Bioinformatics covers the application of mathematics, statistics and computing to biological and clinical scenarios. Algorithms and software tools are used to understand and interpret patient-derived ‘Big Data’.WHAT'S
